meanings.definition: The action of making something political.
meanings.sent1: The politicization of the school board led to heated debates among parents.
meanings.sent2: The politicization of healthcare has caused disagreements among policymakers.
meanings.sent3: The politicization of choosing a class pet resulted in a funny argument between students.
meanings.sent4: The politicization of the office coffee machine turned the break room into a battleground.
meanings.sent5: The politicization of the neighborhood watch program made everyone suspicious of each other.

meanings.definition: The process of bringing something under political control or influence.
meanings.sent1: The politicization of the media has raised concerns about biased reporting.
meanings.sent2: The politicization of the judiciary system can undermine the rule of law.
meanings.sent3: The politicization of the company picnic planning led to some comical power struggles.
meanings.sent4: The politicization of social media turned online platforms into virtual political arenas.
meanings.sent5: The politicization of the book club made reading sessions feel like political debates.
